intro: Eureiandra lasiandra, commonly known as the silky balm, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Eureiandra lasiandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate foliage and subtle fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to gardens.
